more_content:
Steps away from our resort you’ll find a few of our favorite open-air, waterfront restaurants and bars with the best seaport views and happy hours on the island. You don’t have to go far to enjoy the happiest of hours in Key West. Each one of these establishments offers a casual fun atmosphere with a view and some unique island experiences you won’t find anywhere else.

Begin or end your stroll at The Marker

Before or after your Seaport Happy Hour Stroll head over to Cero Bodega, our poolside bar, and enjoy $2 off drinks and $5 small plates. Happy Hour at Cero Bodega begins at 3:30pm.

Sip and stroll through the Harbor and visit our five happy hour hot spots:

 

Half Shell Raw Bar

First stop on our Happy Hour stroll is the Half Shell Raw Bar, a favorite amongst the locals and captains due to its location and proximity to the Key West commercial fishing fleet. It’s one of the best seafood restaurants on the island too. Enjoy raw oysters on the Half Shell, a bucket of steamed clams or clams on the half shell - just few of our favorites during happy hour. Half Shell offers ½ off beer, house wine and well drinks from 4:30 - 6:30pm daily

Photo credit: patcroceandcompany.com

Did you Know: Half Shell Raw Bar is featured on the cover of Kenny Chesney’s hit single, ““When I See This Bar”

Half Shell Raw Bar

Hours: 11am - 10pm Monday thru Saturday | 12pm - 10pm Sunday

Happy Hour: 4:30 -6:30pm

 

231 Margaret St. Key West, FL 33040

Turtle Kraals

One of our favorite places to enjoy Happy Hour and sunset is the Tower Bar at Turtle Kraals. In addition to the food, drinks and happy hour specials you’ll have a front row seat to a spectacular sunset in paradise.

Did you know: There’s something extra special happening here, it’s the evening Turtle Races.

 

One of the must-see-and-dos in Key West is to watch and/or take part in the Key West Turtle Kraals Turtle Races held Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 7pm. Slow and Steady Wins the Race! Here’s how you can participate: starting at 4:30pm grab a free numbered ticket from the bartender and enjoy cocktails and a bite to eat. You’ll know when the race is about to start as crowds will gather to watch four box turtles scurry from start to finish. If your ticket number matches the number painted in tape on the back of the winning turtle, you’ll get a key and chance to open a treasure box with cash prize inside. Please call the restaurant for Turtle Race summer hours as the heat does impact our little friends.

Turtle Kraals

Open 11am - 10pm

Happy Hour 4:30 - 6:30pm daily

½ off Beer, House Wine, Well Drinks.

Turtle Races M.W.F. 7pm

231 Margaret St. Key West, FL 33040
